page.title: 06LONG LAWFORD IV
page.content:
Occupations
The majority of the working residents work in the industrial estate in Rugby.There are alternative sources of income in the town centre. Long Lawford itself has little to offer in the way of employment, aside from teaching and serving in the local shops and pubs. Work can also be found in the sewage or cement works on the outskirts of Long Lawford or obviously on one of the many farms surrounding the village. Although this does not sound like much, many of the occupants are Old Aged Pensioners, housewives and children.Therefore, apart from the inevitable out of work factor, the available jobs are adequate.
